alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 29 at 8:22PM CDT until September 03 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Boeuf River Near Fort Necessity affecting Franklin Parish. For the Lower Ouachita...including Alto, Fort Necessity, Tendal, Newlight, Como, Clayton, Jonesville L&D, Acme...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Boeuf River Near Fort Necessity. * WHEN...Until late Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 50 feet, Widespread flooding of farm and agricultural land is occurring along and near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 51.2 feet and cresting. - Forecast...The river is expected to begin falling overnight, going below flood stage by early this weekend. - Flood stage is 50 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Boeuf River Fort Necessit 50.0 51.2 Mon 7 pm CDT 51.2 51.0 50.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 24 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.
